description.narrative: The Third Climate Change Development Policy Operation Program (DPO3) aims to support the Government of Vietnam (GoV) in its efforts to address climate change by adopting policies and strengthening institutional capacity to promote climate resilient and lower carbon intensity development. It is the third of a series of three operations of an amount ofUS$70.0 million equivalent. Vietnam has witnessed impressive economic growth and poverty reduction in the past 25 years. Political and economic reforms have transformed Vietnam from one of the poorest countries in the world, with per capita income below US$100, to a lower middle-income country within a quarter of a century. In 2012, Vietnam's per capita income was estimated at US$1,755. Using a 'basic needs' poverty line initially agreed in 19982, the poverty headcount fell from 58 percent in the early 1990s, to 14.5 percent by 2008, and is expected to be well under 10 percent by 2014. The country has attained five of its ten original Millennium Development Goal targets and likely to attain two more by 2015. Reforms in the early nineties contributed to major competitiveness gains, which enabled a structural shift from agriculture to manufacturing and services. Investments in physical capital and human resources led to increased capital and labor productivity. Vietnam's membership of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and the World Trade Organization (WTO) in 1995 and 2007 respectively, and a series of bilateral trade agreements, promoted reforms and led to higher private and public sector investments.

title.narrative: Implementation of key IWRM actions & organizational framework for IWRM for programmatic, integrated, & adaptative approach to waterresources management for CCA.

baseline.value: Insufficient legal and institutional basis for integrated water resources management needed for CCA.

target.value: Minimum flows established for the Vu Gia-Thu Bon and Ba rivers and used to guide water allocations decisions during the dry season.

actual.value: (i) Three high-level legal IWRM instruments operational: (1) the new Law on Water Resources (LWR) with its implementation Decreeissued providing effectiveness to the Law; (2) the Decree on Administrative Sanctions in Water Resources; and (3) the NationalAction Plan for Water Resources Management (NAP-WRM) with list of priority tasks defined, budget needs identified and first actionsfinanced and implemented in FY 15 budget. (ii) Flood and dry season minimum water levels have been established for the Ba Riverreservoir and are included in the government's Prime Minister Decision 1077 as guidance for water use allocations in the dryseasons. Regulations have also been established for minimum water levels for the dry and flood-season for the Vu Gia-Thu Bon RiverBasin followed the Decision issued by the Prime Minister.

title.narrative: GoV has improved its planning, prioritization and financing for climate

baseline.value: No agreed tool in place within the MPI SEDP process to plan and prioritize climate adaptation actionNo Province has disaster riskmanagement and reduction plans in placeAddressing Disaster risk hazards relies on dispersed and diverse legalframeworksDisaster Risk Reduction and Climate Change Adaptation are related and coordinated on an ad hoc basis between GoVagencies, development partners, research institutes and NGOs

target.value: i) An Adaptation Prioritization Framework is operational within MPI SEDP annual cycles and initial implementationreflected in MPISEDP annual guideline frameworks and budget reportsii) Provinces have disaster risk management and reduction plans underimplementation as reflected in the Government Report on Evaluation of 5 years implementation of the National Strategy for DRMiii)A comprehensive unified legal framework to address climate hazards is operational enabling a stronger focus

actual.value: i) The Adaptation Prioritization Framework (APRF) is operational within the Ministry of Planning and Investment (MPI) SocioeconomicDevelopment Plan (SEDP) guidelines and its initial implementation is reflected in MPI's annual Socio-Economic Development Strategy(SEDS) frameworks for 2014 and 2015. Capacity to create and implement a systemic reporting process to track the extent of theAPRF'suse is still being developed..ii) The government's latest evaluation report confirms that all 63 provinces have had DRM&Rplans under implementation since at least 2012 (when the current five-year plans were submitted to the Ministry of Agriculture andRural Development).iii) A comprehensive legal framework is operational that helps enable a stronger focus on disaster riskreduction. The framework is embodied in the 2013 Disaster Risk Management Law and its 2014 Implementation Decree. The law formallybecame effective in late 2014..

title.narrative: Practices to improve energy efficiency are implemented in large energy users of the industrial sector with related operating capacity increased.

title.narrative: Additional financial resources for climate change action are mobilized, planned according to priorities and a multi-sector allocation process and reported subsequently

baseline.value: i) No additional Financial Mechanism for allocating budget for climate change actionii) No government unit responsible forfacilitation/awareness raising on access to climate change financing

target.value: Additional financial resources are mobilized for climate action, planned according to priorities and a multisector allocationprocess, and reported subsequently

actual.value: A dedicated financing mechanism was created for allocating budget for climate action and substantial additional financial resourceshave been mobilized as evidenced by the increase in approved budget to the financing mechanism from VND 460.8 billion in 2013 toVND 3,000 billion in 2015. Awareness of the availability of financing is high, generating a stream of funding proposals fromprovinces and municipalities that are screened by a selection committee comprising key government ministries to ensure alignmentwith priorities and a multisectoral allocation process.
